translation.en: [man] When I was eight and a half, I went to Comiskey Park.
translation.es: Cuando tenía ocho años y medio,fui a Comiskey Park.

translation.en: And I was holding hands with my father.
translation.es: Iba de la mano de mi padre.

translation.en: And somebody told me that my dad ran the Chicago White Sox.
translation.es: Y alguien me dijoque mi papá dirigía los Chicago White Sox.

translation.en: And I thought that was so cool
translation.es: Me pareció genial

translation.en: that he had this playground where guys played baseball.
translation.es: que tuviera un parquedonde se jugara al béisbol.

translation.en: But mostly, now what I remember is holding his hand.
translation.es: Pero lo que más recuerdoes que iba de su mano.

translation.en: [Jeff Daniels] This is the true story of a family of baseball hustlers.
translation.es: Esta es la historia real de una familiade ilusionistas del béisbol.

translation.en: It's a story about fathers and sons, and fathers and daughters.
translation.es: Es una historia sobre padres e hijosy padres e hijas.

translation.en: You know, the complicated stuff.
translation.es: Ya saben, lo más complicado.

translation.en: Now we're going to spend a lot of time talking about the infamous Bill Veeck.
translation.es: Vamos a pasar mucho tiempohablando del infame Bill Veeck.

translation.en: But the real hero of our story is his son, Mike,
translation.es: Pero el héroe de esta historiaes su hijo, Mike,

translation.en: a guy who struggled to be a good son and accidentally became a great dad.
translation.es: un tipo al que le costó ser buen hijoy, sin querer, se volvió un gran papá.

translation.en: [Mike] Where do we even start?
translation.es: ¿Por dónde empezamos?

translation.en: It's just kind of a weird story.
translation.es: Es una historia medio rara.

translation.en: [Daniels] Let's start at the bottom.
translation.es: Empecemos por lo peor.

translation.en: Florida in the '80s.
translation.es: Florida en los años 80.

translation.en: Mike Veeck had lost everything that mattered to him.
translation.es: Mike Veeck había perdidotodo lo que le importaba.

translation.en: [Daniels] There was a time when the Veeck name used to mean something.
translation.es: En una época,el apellido Veeck significaba algo.

translation.en: His father, Bill, was the peg-legged owner of a string of teams,
translation.es: Su padre, Bill, tenía una pata de paloy varios equipos,

translation.en: including the Chicago White Sox.
translation.es: incluidos los Chicago White Sox.

translation.en: He had the audacity to believe
translation.es: Tuvo la audacia de creer

translation.en: that baseball wasn't about winning or losing or even money.
translation.es: que el béisbol no era cuestiónde ganar, de perder ni de dinero,

translation.en: It was about something more.
translation.es: sino de algo más.

translation.en: We have never sold a game
translation.es: Nunca vendimos el deporte

translation.en: as the most delightful way to spend an afternoon or an evening.
translation.es: como la forma más bellade pasar una tarde o noche.

translation.en: [Daniels] Bill wasn't just another owner.
translation.es: Bill no era como los otros dueños.

translation.en: Bill changed baseball.
translation.es: Bill cambió el béisbol.

translation.en: And Mike, in trying to prove himself,
translation.es: Y Mike, al intentar demostrar su valía,

translation.en: blew it all up.
translation.es: tiró todo a la basura.

translation.en: [man chanting] Disco sucks!
translation.es: ¡El disco apesta!

translation.en: Disco sucks!
translation.es: ¡El disco apesta!

translation.en: [Daniels] You know, Bill had a saying. That at the end of nine innings,
translation.es: Bill siempre decía esto:"Al final de las nueve entradas,

translation.en: you know who won, you know who lost.
translation.es: sabes quién ganó, sabes quién perdió.

translation.en: But most importantly, you get to start all over the next day.
translation.es: Pero lo más importante es que al día siguientepuedes empezar otra vez".

translation.en: ♪ Gloria ♪ ♪ I'm gonna shout it all night ♪ ♪ Gloria ♪
translation.es: EL SANTO DE LAS SEGUNDAS OPORTUNIDADES

translation.en: [interviewer] Let's go back to when you were starting out.
translation.es: Volvamos al principio.

translation.en: How much were you trying to get away from your father's shadow?
translation.es: ¿Cuánto buscabasescapar de la sombra de tu padre?

translation.en: How much?
translation.es: ¿Cuánto?

translation.en: I don't know. Maybe 140%. I mean--
translation.es: No sé, un 140 %, quizá. Digo…

translation.en: I wanted nothing to do with--
translation.es: No quería tener nada que ver con…

translation.en: With the-- You know, what had already become the legendary stories.
translation.es: Con lo que ya eran anécdotas legendarias.

translation.en: And it wasn't that I didn't admire my father or love my father.
translation.es: No es que no admirarao no quisiera a mi padre.

translation.en: I just wanted no part of that constant comparison.
translation.es: Pero no quería viviren esa comparación constante.

translation.en: There seemed to be no way that you could win.
translation.es: Mi sensación era que era imposible ganar.

translation.en: It's 1975, and baseball's for losers.
translation.es: Es 1975, y el béisbol es para fracasados.

translation.en: [Daniels] Mike was doing anything he could to get away from Bill's shadow.
translation.es: Mike hacía todo lo posiblepara alejarse de la sombra de Bill.

translation.en: [Mike] He would show up every once in a while at places where we'd play.
translation.es: A veces venía a nuestros conciertos.

translation.en: [director] How would you feel about playing your dad in this movie?
translation.es: ¿Te gustaría hacer de tu papáen esta película?

translation.en: I'm not cutting off my leg. Period.
translation.es: No me pienso cortar la pierna.

translation.en: When he goes, "Let's have lunch,"
translation.es: Cuando decía: "Vamos a almorzar",

translation.en: that was a euphemism in our house for "Let's go drink beer."
translation.es: todos sabíamos que quería decir:"Vamos a tomar una cerveza".

translation.en: We drank a lot of beer.
translation.es: Bebimos mucha cerveza.

translation.en: And I don't know, a scant 11 hours later,
translation.es: No sé, unas 11 horitas después,

translation.en: he said to me, "I'm gonna go to Chicago, and I'm gonna buy the White Sox."
translation.es: me dijo: "Me voy a Chicagoa comprar los White Sox.

translation.en: "And I'd love you to come." And I was flabbergasted.
translation.es: Y me encantaría que vinieras".Me quedé mudo.

translation.en: I was, like, just blown away.
translation.es: Estaba totalmente sorprendido.

translation.en: I can see him pick up the flute
translation.es: Casi que lo vi tomar la flauta

translation.en: right across the table from me, in between beers,
translation.es: de ahí, de la mesa,entre una y otra cerveza,

translation.en: and start to play this music.
translation.es: para empezar a tocar su música.

translation.en: …I don't know. [laughs]
translation.es: No sé.

translation.en: I mean, he was the Pied Piper.
translation.es: Era el Flautista de Hamelin.

translation.en: When he said, "You know, this could be the last hurrah,"
translation.es: Y me dijo: "Este podría sermi último truco".

translation.en: he made no bones about the fact that we were going to be underfinanced.
translation.es: Y dejó muy claroque íbamos a estar cortos de dinero.

translation.en: There wasn't enough money.
translation.es: No nos alcanzaba.

translation.en: It was us against the world. We're gonna do something
translation.es: Éramos nosotros contra el mundo.Íbamos a hacer algo

translation.en: that are gonna make people sit up and take notice.
translation.es: que le iba a llamarla atención a la gente.

translation.en: It was a crusade.
translation.es: Era una cruzada.

translation.en: We were on the side of all that was good and light.
translation.es: Y nosotros estábamos del lado del bien.

translation.en: Cheers to that.
translation.es: Brindo por eso.

translation.en: And I said to him, you know--
translation.es: Y le dije…

translation.en: We don't really know each other, right?
translation.es: No nos conocemos bien, ¿no?

translation.en: And he said, "Well, maybe it would be a chance to get to know each other."
translation.es: Y me dijo: "Quizános permita conocernos mejor".

translation.en: And that was it. He had me hook, line, and sinker.
translation.es: Y eso fue todo. Me hizo picar.

translation.en: [Daniels] So, now instead of running from his dad's shadow,
translation.es: Así que, en vez de escaparde la sombra de su padre,

translation.en: Mike was running towards it.
translation.es: Mike ahora la perseguía.

translation.en: If ignorance is bliss, then Mike was in heaven.
translation.es: Si la ignorancia es una bendición,Mike estaba en el cielo.

translation.en: [interviewer] So what was the first day like?
translation.es: ¿Cómo fue el primer día?

translation.en: It was horrible. What do you think it was like?
translation.es: Horrible, ¿tú qué crees?

translation.en: It was what the world didn't need, was another owner's kid.
translation.es: Lo que menos necesitaba el mundoera otro hijo de un dueño.

translation.en: You could almost see people roll their eyes. I mean, just… Oh!
translation.es: Casi que me miraban con hartazgo.

translation.en: "God, I never expected this from Bill Veeck,
translation.es: "Dios, no esperaba esto de Bill Veeck,

translation.en: for him to employ one of his kids."
translation.es: que contratara a uno de sus hijos".

translation.en: But I can outwork you.
translation.es: Pero podía trabajar más que ellos.

translation.en: And that was my plan.
translation.es: Ese era mi plan.

translation.en: I was just gonna go, and I was gonna outwork everybody.
translation.es: Iba a trabajar más que nadie.

translation.en: If everybody stayed 16 hours,
translation.es: Si todos se quedaban 16 horas,

translation.en: I was gonna stay 17 hours and earn their respect.
translation.es: yo me quedaría 17 horasy me ganaría su respeto.

translation.en: And I think that his attitude would have been,
translation.es: Y creo que su actitud habría sido…

translation.en: "Well, if he flames out because he's not very smart, that's okay."
translation.es: "Bueno, si fracasaporque no es muy listo, está bien".

translation.en: So, it was also a test to see if--
translation.es: También era una prueba para ver

translation.en: You know, if I had any stuff.
translation.es: de qué era capaz.

translation.en: And I was terrified.
translation.es: Yo estaba aterrado.

translation.en: [reporter] Here they are. Hi, Veecks. Let's just walk around and get their names.
translation.es: Aquí están. Hola, familia Veeck.Queremos saber sus nombres.

translation.en: -What is your name? -Michael Veeck.
translation.es: - ¿Cómo te llamas?- Michael Veeck.

translation.en: -How old are you, Michael? -Eleven.
translation.es: - ¿Qué edad tienes?- Once.

translation.en: Eleven years old.
translation.es: Once años.

translation.en: [Mike] We lived in this old house.
translation.es: Vivíamos en una casa antigua.

translation.en: There were nine kids.
translation.es: Éramos nueve hijos.

translation.en: And so, growing up, we would have fire drills.
translation.es: De chicos,hacíamos simulacros de incendio.

translation.en: My job was to grab the idea box.
translation.es: Mi trabajo era tomar la caja de ideas.

translation.en: And the idea box was filled with every gag
translation.es: Y la caja de ideasestaba llena de todos los trucos

translation.en: that Mom and Dad or visitors had thought of.
translation.es: que se les habían ocurridoa mamá, a papá o a las visitas.

translation.en: In our house, cocktail napkins and matchbooks, especially,
translation.es: En nuestra casa, las servilletasy las cajas de fósforos, sobre todo,

translation.en: were considered card files.
translation.es: se consideraban ficheros.

translation.en: If the house was on fire,
translation.es: Si la casa se incendiaba,

translation.en: you didn't grab the art.
translation.es: no ibas a buscar los cuadros.

translation.en: What a wonderful lesson.
translation.es: Qué lección maravillosa.

translation.en: And I never forgot that.
translation.es: Y jamás la olvidé.

translation.en: [reporter] Bill, what's behind your theory of showmanship in baseball?
translation.es: Bill, ¿en qué se basa tu teoríadel espectáculo del béisbol?

translation.en: Well, I happen to have a very ridiculous theory,
translation.es: Resulta que tengouna teoría bastante ridícula,

translation.en: according to great many ball club operators, that it should be fun.
translation.es: o eso dicen varios operadores:el béisbol debería ser divertido.

translation.en: [Daniels] In December of '75, Bill begged and borrowed enough money
translation.es: En diciembre de 1975,Bill consiguió un préstamo

translation.en: to buy the Chicago White Sox.
translation.es: para comprar los White Sox de Chicago.

translation.en: But keep in mind, this was insane.
translation.es: Pero era una locura, recuerden.

translation.en: He'd been out of the game for over a decade at this point,
translation.es: Hacía más de una décadaque no estaba en el rubro

translation.en: and things had changed.
translation.es: y todo había cambiado.

translation.en: Bill wasn't rich like today's owners.
translation.es: Bill no era rico como los dueños de hoy.

translation.en: He was the last of the old-time baseball hustlers.
translation.es: Fue el últimode los antiguos ilusionistas del béisbol.

translation.en: We have been pursuing this for some time,
translation.es: Hace tiempo que queremos esto

translation.en: and it, on occasion, looked as if we might not make it.
translation.es: y llegamos a creer que era imposible,

translation.en: And so, you really must forgive me
translation.es: así que les pido perdón

translation.en: for not having prepared a magnificent oration.
translation.es: si no tengo preparadoun discurso grandilocuente.

translation.en: He was the return of the savior.

translation.en: There wasn't a lot of hope.

translation.en: -Bill! How you doing? -[laughing] Hi. Fine, thanks.
translation.es: - ¡Bill! ¿Qué tal?- Bien, gracias.

translation.en: All right. So!
translation.es: ¡Genial!

translation.en: [Mike] There was rejoicing in the streets.
translation.es: Había fiesta en las calles.

translation.en: In Chicago?
translation.es: ¿En Chicago?

translation.en: Oh, couldn't get no bigger than Bill Veeck.
translation.es: Nadie más grande que Bill Veeck.

translation.en: He was the man.
translation.es: Era todo un héroe.

translation.en: [Mike] He was in the phone book.
translation.es: Estaba en la guía telefónica.

translation.en: He frequented the same saloons that they went to.
translation.es: Iba a los mismos salones que ellos.

translation.en: He used cabs as a source of marketing research.
translation.es: Usaba los taxis de fuentepara su investigación de mercado.

translation.en: And even now, people tell me, "I was a Sox fan because of the owner."
translation.es: Todavía hoy me dicen: "Era fande los White Sox por su dueño".

translation.en: [Mike] He was one of them. That's exactly how they felt.
translation.es: Él era uno más, esa era la sensación.

translation.en: [Daniels] And if Chicago was the Second City,
translation.es: Y si Chicago era la Segunda Ciudad,

translation.es: los White Sox siempre habían sidosu segundo equipo.

translation.en: Scrappy underdogs to the crosstown Cubs.

translation.en: [Dombrowski] We knew we weren't really a very good club.
translation.es: Sabíamos que no éramos un buen club.

translation.en: There were no expectations of winning your division or winning a pennant.

translation.en: [Chicoine] But Bill had a plan.

translation.en: Get people in the seats and good things will happen.

translation.en: Oh, this is a wonderful ballpark.

translation.en: [Daniels] Bill didn't have an office.
translation.es: Bill no tenía oficina.

translation.en: He ran the team from a little bar deep inside Comiskey.
translation.es: Dirigía el equipo desde un barcitoubicado en el complejo.

translation.en: The press and visiting teams were always welcome.
translation.es: La prensa y los equipos visitantessiempre eran bienvenidos.

translation.en: It was the Bard's Room.
translation.es: Era el Bard's Room.

translation.en: [Mike] You walk into the Bard's Room,
translation.es: Si entrabas al Bard's Room,

translation.en: and suddenly, all of these baseball cards come alive.
translation.es: de repente, todas las tarjetas de béisbolcobraban vida.

translation.en: And now I had to figure out how I could earn a seat at that table.
translation.es: Tenía que averiguarcómo ganarme un lugar en la mesa.

translation.en: [Bill] I'm pretty good.
translation.es: Soy muy bueno.

translation.en: I've seen more ball games than almost anybody you can find around.

translation.en: [Daniels] This is an understatement.

translation.en: Bill has seen it all.
translation.es: Bill lo había visto todo.

translation.en: His dad ran the Cubs.
translation.es: Su padre dirigía a los Cubs.

translation.en: So, when he was a gopher like Mike, he planted the famous ivy at Wrigley.

translation.es: con Larry Doby y Satchel Paige.

translation.en: But what you don't hear is that legend has it, years before Jackie Robinson,
translation.es: Pero nadie sabe que, según la leyenda,años antes de Jackie Robinson,

translation.es: él planeó comprar a los Phillies

translation.en: and replace all the white players with Black players.

translation.en: But that plan didn't get very far.
translation.es: Pero el plan no llegó muy lejos.

translation.en: All the fun stuff that happens at baseball games today,

translation.en: fireworks, giveaways, promos, you name it, Bill invented it.
translation.es: pirotecnia, regalos, promociones…Todo lo inventó Bill.

translation.en: Oh, and he also brought in this guy, Eddie Gaedel, to pinch-hit one time.
translation.es: También trajo a este tipo,Eddie Gaedel, a batear una vez.

translation.en: He was a dwarf. It's a whole other story.
translation.es: Era enano. Pero esa es otra historia.

translation.en: So, yeah, Bill knows a thing or two about baseball.
translation.es: Sí, Bill sabía bastante sobre béisbol.

translation.en: No, what you are creating is a ground rule in which greed reigns supreme.
translation.es: Están creando una regla básicaen la que rige la avaricia.

translation.en: And after every home game, I'd come up there.
translation.es: Después de los partidos de locales,iba a verlo.

translation.en: -He loved to stimulate a conversation. -Now…
translation.es: - Le encantaba dar charla.- Ahora bien…

translation.en: [La Russa] And once it got going, he'd just sit back with a big smile on his face.
translation.es: Cuando todos hablaban,se recostaba y sonreía.

translation.en: That's where the education came from.
translation.es: De ahí provenía su sabiduría.

translation.en: [Mike] I was mute. I got beers for people. I fetched.
translation.es: Yo no decía nada, les llevaba cerveza.Les traía lo que pedían.

translation.en: It was a crusade.

translation.en: And I was on my own crusade too.
translation.es: Y yo tenía mi propia cruzada.

translation.en: [Dombrowski] Mike wanted to keep him in the game.
translation.es: Mike quería mantenerlo en el juego.

translation.en: And we knew that if the White Sox situation broke up,
translation.es: Sabíamos que si el temade los White Sox no funcionaba,

translation.en: that that would mean the end of he and his dad
translation.es: se acabaría ese vínculo con su papá

translation.en: probably ever working together or being together.
translation.es: y ya no volverían a trabajaro a estar juntos.

translation.en: [Daniels] And Bill Veeck was a marked man. The other owners, the baseball purists,
translation.es: Y Bill Veeck era un hombre destacado. Sus pares, los puristas del béisbol,solo querían verlo fracasar.

translation.en: they wanted nothing more than to see him fail.
translation.es: Sus pares, los puristas del béisbol,solo querían verlo fracasar.

translation.en: Bill was gonna have to pull out all the stops to stay afloat.

translation.es: Por favor, una sola fila en la puerta.

translation.en: Okay, now, this song we're gonna play for Bill Veeck. Here we go.

translation.en: [Mike] In 1977, boy, we needed a miracle.
translation.es: En 1977, necesitábamos un milagro.

translation.en: Happy days. The opening day today, all right!
translation.es: Es un gran día. Hoy inauguramos.

translation.en: Go, White Sox!
translation.es: ¡Vamos, White Sox!

translation.es: ¿Qué les vendía a los fans?

translation.en: It was very simple.
translation.es: Algo muy sencillo.

translation.en: [Bill] There's nothing to giving everyone in a ballpark an Eskimo Pie.
translation.es: No significa nada regalarle a cada personaun helado Eskimo Pie,

translation.en: But to give one person 30,000 Eskimo Pies,
translation.es: pero regalarle 30 000 heladosa una sola persona

translation.en: now that causes some interesting thought.

translation.en: And we're gonna constantly try new things.

translation.es: Juntos, instalaronuna barbería en el campo,

translation.en: the shorts.

translation.es: Lo más peligroso eran las barridas.

translation.es: Mientras, el equipo mejoraba.

translation.es: lo cual intensificó la actividadde uno de los grandes trucos de Bill:

translation.en: the exploding scoreboard.

translation.en: [reporter] So, Mike, can you explain to me how this all works?

translation.en: What my dad realized is, uh, home runs, they're basically dull, right? You know?
translation.es: Mi papá se dio cuentade que los jonrones son aburridos.

translation.en: So we sort of figured out, "Okay, how do we spice things up a little bit?"
translation.es: Entonces, nos pusimos a pensarcómo ponerle más picante.

translation.en: -[announcer] Drive way back! -[crowd roars excitedly]
translation.es: ¡Miren cómo se va!

translation.en: Might be outta here! It could be! It is!

translation.en: He called me one day out of the blue. Out of the blue.
translation.es: Un día, me llamó de la nada.

translation.en: And said, "This one feels pretty good."
translation.es: Y dijo: "Este me gusta".

translation.en: [Mike] Wait till I show you the new fireworks.
translation.es: Ya verás los fuegos artificiales.Son increíbles.

translation.en: They are unbelievable. You've never seen anything like it.
translation.es: Ya verás los fuegos artificiales.Son increíbles. Nunca viste algo así.

translation.en: [Libby] He's the Pied Piper.
translation.es: Es el Flautista de Hamelin.

translation.en: And he'll be that, you know, until he's gone.
translation.es: Y lo será hasta su último día.

translation.en: [Mike] So, all this, you think to yourself, "Where do I fit in?"
translation.es: Te preguntarás cuál es tu lugar aquí.

translation.en: That's the thing.
translation.es: Esa es la cuestión.

translation.en: I'd just like to spend one year where I get to work for you.
translation.es: Quiero pasar un añoen el que pueda trabajar para ti.

translation.en: With you, but for you.
translation.es: Contigo, pero para ti.

translation.en: It would be an honor for me.
translation.es: Sería un honor para mí.

translation.en: [Mike] My dad used to say,
translation.es: Mi papá siempre decía:

translation.en: "A hustler's not a con man. The hustler believes."
translation.es: "El ilusionista no es estafador.El ilusionista cree".

translation.en: My dad was a hustler. We're all hustlers.
translation.es: Mi papá era ilusionista. Todos lo somos.

translation.en: We believe.
translation.es: Creemos.

translation.en: ♪ I'll write you a letter ♪
translation.es: LOS SAINTS SON EL MIEMBRO AAADE LAS CIUDADES GEMELAS

translation.en: ♪ Tomorrow ♪
translation.es: DARRYL STRAWBERRY AHORA ES MINISTRO

translation.en: ♪ Tonight ♪
translation.es: DAVE STEVENS ES PRODUCTOR DE TVGANADOR DEL EMMY

translation.en: ♪ I can't hold a pen ♪
translation.es: ILA BORDERS ES BOMBERA EN OREGÓN

translation.en: ♪ That I can borrow ♪
translation.es: BILL VEECKLLEGÓ AL SALÓN DE LA FAMA EN 1991

translation.en: ♪ I promise not to blow The address again ♪
translation.es: MIKE Y NIGHT TRAIN TRABAJANEN UN NUEVO EQUIPO DE LAS LIGAS MENORES ACABAN DE COMPRAR 500 ALFOMBRILLAS…
